intro: Gomphrena demissa, commonly known as the common gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. The plant produces showy, spiky flower heads that range in color from pink to red, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gomphrena demissa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
